Text:
...This place is surprisingly sparse! The town is
barely functioning!

I mean, this is a town...right? It's more desolate
than the mountain villages in Midgar Kingdom...
We've travelled so much...I'm beyond sleepy...

...I don't see a single store that's open... I don't
think I'm far off in calling this a ghost town.

If the central town looks like this, I'm guessing the
surrounding villages and settlements have already
fallen into ruin...
Alright...let's start looking for oil—

Hold on a minute, Eta! Before we do that, we need to
get a proper grasp of this town!

If this is going to be an ongoing expedition to find
oil fields, along with the surrounding environment
and geology...then it's an absolute must!
...Hmm... Fine. So, where and how do we investigate?
Where? Well, of course—
U-Umm...in cases like this...

...The town hall! That's it! This place has got to
have some sort of town hall! I mean, it's not like
it's an actual ghost town!
Whoa... You've got this, Gamma!

Quit acting like it's someone else's problem!
You're helping out as well, Eta!

"Madlid is a territory within the Vegalta Empire.
Encompassed by mountains, it is the empire's
easternmost town."

"To reach the nearest town on foot, one must endure a
week-long trek along steep mountainous paths."

"As for horse-drawn wagons laden with goods,
a month's journey is to be expected, owing to the
detour routes necessary for safe travel."

"The suburbs of Midgar and even the lands owned by
the Kagenou family appear magnificently metropolitan
compared to this place."
—From Gamma's Field Notes

...The town is severely depopulated, and with those
steep mountain roads, it lacks any developed means
of transport.

It's like the town is on its deathbed...or, no, as if
it's stuck in time.

Even if there was an oil field around here, we'd have
a tough time figuring out how to actually transport
the oil.
Eta?

...A lot of old buildings. Never seen this style of
architecture before... Interesting.
Yes, the streets are incredibly old-fashioned...

...Why do so many old buildings line the main street
in such a remote town?

I'm sure it took significant building materials,
supplies, and manpower to construct all these
buildings.

In other words, bringing goods and materials here
should be absolutely impossible with the transport
conditions in Madlid.

So...it wasn't this deserted before. Maybe...the
roads leading here were easier to navigate.

Exactly. In other words, the town was ruined by some
fatal transport barrier.

Let's do a little more research on this place before
we start looking for potential oil field sites, Eta.
No...I mean emerging architect Eta Lloyd Wright!
Hmm?

Let's gather more intel based on your professional
viewpoint as well!
